content.question: Two identical books are stacked on a table. A third identical book is then placed on top of the first two, causing an increase in the normal force exerted by the bottom book on the middle book. Which of the following is a correct explanation for the increase in this normal force?

choices.label: The normal force on an object is equal in magnitude and opposite in direction to the force of gravity on that object.
The addition of the top book causes the force of gravity on the table to increase.
The forces of gravity on the bottom book and middle book increase because of the additional mass of the top book.
The third book produces an additional downward force on the middle book, thus increasing the upward force exerted by the bottom book to maintain equilibrium.

content.answer: The third book produces an additional downward force on the middle book, thus increasing the upward force exerted by the bottom book to maintain equilibrium.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
